page.title: 18Wem Post Office 2
page.content: sort the second delivery using the letters from Shrewsbury together with the ones they have brought back from local postboxes. This goes out at 1O.45 a.m. and the letters collected on the way back are sent by van to Shrewsbury about Midday. 3.OO p.m is the last collection from the postboxes. This is sorted and at 6.3O p.m. a van delivers these letters to Shrewsbury. The average number of letters dealt with a day in the sorting office is 3,500, and of parcels, a hundred.The total is 21,000 letters and 3,600 packets and parcels in a six day week. The busiest days are Wednesday, Thursday and Friday.There are six postboxes in Wem and twenty four nearby. The postcode for Wem is SY4 5. SY is for Shrewsbury, 4 shows it is in north Shropshire and 5 is for Wem.
